item.title: CSC 201: Data Structures and Algorithms
item.description:
Syllabus: TBA

[Section B Lectures: Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays - 9:00am to 9:50pm](Canvas Link TBA)

Communication-Avoiding Machine Learning

Machine learning has gained renewed interest in recent years due to advances in computer hardware (processing power and high-bandwidth storage) and the availability of large amounts of data which can be used to develop accurate, robust models. While hardware improvements have facilitated the development of machine learning models on a single machine, the analysis of large amounts of data still requires parallel computers to obtain shorter running times.

Wake Forest University

Fall 2024, Spring 2025, Fall 2025

On leave
Please see my Google Scholar page for an up to date list of preprints and publications.

Bio

Aditya Devarakonda is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at Wake Forest University. Prior to that he was an Assistant Research Scientist in the Department of Physics and Astronomy at Johns Hopkins University. He received his Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of California, Berkeley in 2018 and his B.S in Computer Engineering from Rutgers University, New Brunswick in 2012.
